intro: Wahlenbergia berteroi, commonly known as the silver lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Wahlenbergia berteroi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
